attributes.action: Introduce minimum standards for the funeral industry
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The UK funeral market is estimated to be worth over £1billion annually. 

Shockingly costs have soared by 42 per cent over the last five years.

Hugely more than the rate of inflation, not in line with other industries and definitely not explicable by reasonable economic logic.

The "total cost of dying" is now topping £7,000 according to a study by the market research firm Mintel (Telegraph, 08 Sep 2009). Costs often reach £15,000.  

This results because the funeral industry is unregulated. It claims to be self-regulating through its own bodies.

People who have just suffered a bereavement are particularly vulnerable, so it's vital that the funeral industry is properly and independently regulated.

The facts suggest self-regulation does NOT work.

Nothing has changed since Professor Woodroffe of Brunel University noted that self-regulation is not a good idea for this industry : ".....How on earth can anyone expect regulation processes set up by trade bodies to be impartial and fair? People are extremely vulnerable when they are arranging funerals for relatives or partners. Independent regulation is vital." Telegraph 2002.

Please sign this petition to help everyone.
